section.section:
The Commissioner may enforce the provisions of this subtitle, regulations adopted under § 11-503 of this subtitle, and the applicable provisions of Title 12 of the Commercial Law Article by:
Issuing an order:
To cease and desist from the violation and any further similar violations; and
Requiring the violator to take affirmative action to correct the violation including the restitution of money or property to any person aggrieved by the violation; and
Imposing a civil penalty not exceeding $5,000 for each violation.

If a violator fails to comply with an order issued under paragraph (1)(i) of this subsection, the Commissioner may impose a civil penalty not exceeding $5,000 for each violation from which the violator failed to cease and desist or for which the violator failed to take affirmative action to correct.

text.section: The Commissioner may file a petition in the circuit court for any county seeking enforcement of an order issued under this section.

The employment of a mortgage originator licensed under Subtitle 6 of this title by a mortgage lender does not relieve the mortgage lender of a responsibility under this subtitle, a rule or regulation adopted under this subtitle, or a law governing mortgage lending in the State.
